text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- At least 22 dead and 85 injured after passenger train derailed near city of Pamplona.
- Spain to send 500 soldiers to Albania
- General Secretary of Basque Socialist party (PSE) convinces PSOE to back Basque region's fiscal deal with central government.
- Former Banesto chairman Mario Conde asks to reduce or eliminate bail.
EL MUNDO
- Twenty two dead after train derails in Navarre region because of speed.
- Foreign Minister Abel Matutes out of action for at least two months after heart attack
- Former prime minister Felipe Gonzalez says he is worried Cesid papers could endager Spain's interests, not his own.
- Asensio buys 10 percent of Antena 3 from Banesto to control 62 percent of television chain
LA VANGUARDIA
- Judge reiterates Conde could flee.
CINCO DIAS
- Economy Minister says exclusive deal between Group Corporacion Bancaria de Espana ( Argentaria) and Caja Postal not fair
- Development Minister Rafael Arias Salgado and Telefonica chairman Juan Villalonga find new reason for battle -- policy of digits
- Ibex-35 rose 5 percent in first quarter
EXPANSION
- Stock Exchange ended first quarter with gain of 6.4 percent and 6 trillion pesetas of turnover
- Employers' association CEOE asks Economy Minister Rato to remove requirement to reveal pension plans. Requests that pension plans are deal between firms and workers
- Electrical firms ask to unify nuclear plants
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Santander raises stake in Endesa to 3.2 percent
